author: kborowinski
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

Last tag on *master* is set to `v7.1.0-preview.7` that causes the local builds of up-to-date PowerShell repository to show wrong build number:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16168755/99502197-06670e00-297d-11eb-8cd3-ae2c03e45188.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16168755/99502079-e2a3c800-297c-11eb-8941-6861ab3ce32a.png)

## Steps to reproduce

```git
git fetch --all --tags
git describe
```

## Expected behavior

```none
v7.2.0-preview.1
```

## Actual behavior

```none
v7.1.0-preview.7-141-g9ca6be1d6
```

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
This is fixed by #14138. After sync your local master branch, you will get
```
PS:112> git describe
v7.2.0-preview.1-19-g6dcc50701
```

title: Update tags on master repository
